intro: Haworthia nortieri var. albispina, commonly known as the white-spined haworthia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features compact, rosette-shaped leaves that are typically green with white or pale yellow spines along the edges. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the growing season. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor collections.
